website_summaries.verdict: These rings have a higher-than-average weight limit so heavier customers just starting their fitness journey should consider them.
pros: Includes two gymnastic rings with straps and adjusting buckles
Rings made of textured, grippable plastic to reduce slippage
Capable of supporting up to 2,000 pounds
cons: Buckles can break if not installed correctly, so be sure to follow the installation instructions carefully

customer_reviews.title: Great solid rings
customer_reviews.text: Great solid rings! I hung them up in my office from the rafters. Very sturdy for pull ups, muscle ups, and dips (I'm 6ft 180lbs). They are textured plastic which has a good feel and grip (see pic). These rings are a great add along with a 20kg kettlebell I have to get a good workout in. Tip: Make sure you set up the straps correctly. It's very simple, the rings come with instructions and pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality but not Ideal for Portable Use
customer_reviews.text: These are a good quality and are adjustable. I am giving it four stars because it they really need caribiners or straps to make them easy to install. I use these in my closet hung from a pull-up bar. I had to purchase straps and caribiners to make them easy to take down. These would be 5-star equipment if you have a place to hang them permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Happygret

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic rings that are sturdy and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: A solid set of gymnastic rings. I weigh 215 pounds and these things feel great, sturdy as a rock, and have an insanely LONG rope to hang them on. It is easy to set up, the ropes absolutely DO NOT slip out of the clip if properly installed. What shocks me about these rings is how inexpensive they are despite how well they are made. A side note: I currently use these on my door frame pull up bars (I do rows, dips, and L-Sits) and they are incredible. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Courter

customer_reviews.title: Damaged buckles
customer_reviews.text: To echo another reviewer, the buckles on both rings have shown signs of damage by the springs underneath, with one completely punctured. I don't think they are safe to use anymore. I weigh 140 lbs and have only used the rings discontinuously for less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rings great for a variety of body weight exercises - great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Updated 10/19 - I was contacted by Nayoya and they wanted to know about my experience. I shared with them I was having issues with the straps slipping. They immediately offered to send me a new set. Fantastic customer service This was my first set of gymnastic rings for my garage gym. I use them for dips, various rows and pull ups. I have since purchased a set of wood rings to add to the garage gym. Aside from the preference though my one major complaint about these rings is the straps. They started slipping after I had them for less than two months. I am only 165lbs and expected them to hold up a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: George H

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. Snapped after a month.
customer_reviews.text: Used 2x a week little over a month. One of the rings snapped today while doing a dip. Do yourself a favor and buy from a reputable brand. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brig

customer_reviews.title: Simple, affordable, durable...
customer_reviews.text: Have read that the clasps can slip, but I have used pretty frequently and actually just tugged on them to test limits... NO slippage/give ! Very worth it, if you want to get in shape with natural body weight. Forget the bench, bar and weights. Get a cage and these rings, and save a thousand bucks!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product, disappointing customer service.
customer_reviews.text: These seemed great and exactly what I was looking for. Unfortunately, only a few months into using them, part of the locking mechanism broke. I contacted the manufacturer multiple times and was ignored. I understand that even the best product has a structural flaw. However, ignoring my issue when I contacted them is particularly rude and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Very possibly unsafe for use
customer_reviews.text: The material of the rings themselves are fine. However, both of the metal clasps broke under tension of the strap. This is extremely disconcerting. The fact that the metal clasps snapped so easily makes me think it's only so long until they completely break and you land on your head. I will most certainly be spending more money on a product I can trust.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Tsunami

customer_reviews.title: First time buyer, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used to work out in a gym but I recently got interested in calisthenics, and every guy on youtube out there says you need a pair of these rings. So i looked online and found these ones to be decently priced and gave them a try. THey arrived efficiently packed well and when I tried them out. Very solid. I was worried the plastic instead of wooden handles might be flexible and not as sturdy, but that was not the case. I'm still getting stringer on them, as they have many possible exercises. Overall 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Kameron

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and effective
customer_reviews.text: The straps were a little difficult to push through the buckle initially, but after the 2nd time of hanging them, it was easy to do. The straps are very sturdy and the rings have a nice weight to them. They feel strong and like they can easily hold my weight. I initially hung them on my kids play set in the backyard to do ring rows and dips. I ended up moving them into my basement so I can practice my ring muscle up progressions and ring holds and pull ups. I am happy with the quality of the rings and expect they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: How’s it hanging.
customer_reviews.text: Great gymnastics rings. We’ve got these setup next to an Arial yoga swing and the kids love it. I like how long the straps are so you can move them up and down easily for the little guys to get a turn. Well built and heavier than I expected. Would recommend getting some grip tape to keep from getting blisters
customer_reviews.author: Adam R.

customer_reviews.title: Peace + exercise
customer_reviews.text: Love em, stimulates all my muscles like none other, opened up various options of parks/locations to exercise (trees, bars, basketball courts,etc.) I get sore faster, recover faster, and I'm ready to attack the next session without hesitation. cheaper than that trx stuff and better imho. Trust me I have been searching for an option that stops me from searching, and these rings are it. I have been thru it all (weights, machines, resistance bands, and calisthenics) these rings have stimulated muscles in all types of weird/forgotten areas and I feel great. Get em, research vids on youtube, and good luck. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great rings!
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our garage gym. They go right over the back of our power cage and are really comfortable for a hand grip. They are nice and strong. They can totally handle my 250 pound husband. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product... no slippage issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect product with extremely strong clamping devices that do not slip at all. Any reports of them slipping are most likely due to improper routing of the straps. I use this all the time and the adjustment allows me to to low work (presses), medium work (pulls and above ring moves), and high work (pulls, muscle-ups, etc.). Absolutely satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Simple, Effective, Yellow
customer_reviews.text: While only time will tell the true nature of this product, my month with it has been fantastic. They are quick to setup and breakdown, fit comfortably in my small gym bag, and maintain grip even with sweaty palms. I have not tried doing anything other than strength-based moves on them, so I can't recommend them for trying to do giants or anything. That said, I can recommend them for muscle-ups, pull-ups, handstand work, and the many other things you might want to try. I could potentially see the straps wearing down over time, but in my month of use they haven't shown any signs of that.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: ... the recommendation of Tim Ferriss and they do not disappoint. These are the first piece of equipment you ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these rings on the recommendation of Tim Ferriss and they do not disappoint. These are the first piece of equipment you should buy if you're starting a home gym. In addition to using these for ring dips, pull-ups, ring-rows, L-holds, and ring push-ups, I hang from the rings in the morning and after work which increases shoulder mobility and decompresses the spine-- vital if you sit for the majority of your working day. Rings are easy to set and comfortable to use--no need for chalk, there is plenty of grip on the plastic. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: kgatch

customer_reviews.title: Quality rings at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I got two sets of these rings, and I have been very happy with them. They are sturdy, easy to set up and the grip is comfortable. I was concerned at first about them being plastic rings, but they are the most comfortable plastic rings I have used. So far they've seen a fair amount of use over a month and I've seen no sign of them wearing down.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lidgard

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The grip on these is pretty gnarly, would recommend taping with athletic tape or using chalk with them; otherwise, you will callous and chew up your hands beyond reason. Easy to set up. Was able to reach a low hanging limb to hang them on in the yard. Wrap the limb with a towel, measure your spacing, loop them over, that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Sallyslim77

customer_reviews.title: Good product, defective buckle
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these for me as a gift three years ago and I used them about 3 times a week for around 10 minutes each time. Once in awhile my kids play on them. I'm 175, both of my kids are under 60lbs. After 3 years, the spring that keeps the buckle brake engaged broke through the metal buckle, rendering them unsafe and therefore useless. See my pics. I was happy with them, but super disappointed in this defect. It only happened on one buckle. Hoping the seller will see this and send me another.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon McCarville

customer_reviews.title: Great home alternate to the gym / weights
customer_reviews.text: Great workout alternate to going to the gym - exercise so many stabilizer muscles around the chest, shoulder and back and causes many core muscles in the abs to get activated.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice for Fitness.
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to come up with several home exercise solutions that are not boring, and can easily be done at home; Without going to the gym. I use these every other day. I've had them for just over two weeks and I'm seeing substantial improvements in muscle tone, and overall strength. Can't quite do all of the tricks that I'd like to do, but I'm seeing improvement every time that I use them. Overall, seems like an effective and economical way to improve your workout. I'm no expert on gymnastic rings, but so far I feel that these have been a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: ZeeZee

customer_reviews.title: Great PLASTIC Rings, Grip is So-so
customer_reviews.text: I have used these rings for two years with no issues. They have worked great! 4 stars because compared to pricier wooden rings, the diameter is smaller and the grip is more slippery. I have to use chalk constantly and maintaining a false grip is nearly impossible. For an exercise like a muscle up, which requires a false grip, you really need the better grip and diameter of a wooden ring.
customer_reviews.author: teresa m girolamo

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, great quality, very happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought to make part of home gym during pandemic quarantine. First installed a pull-up bar, then hung these from it. Straps and buckles are sturdy and easy to adjust on the fly (important). Rings themselves have just enough texture to get good, no-slip grip but not leave impressions on hands, and they are VERY sturdy, don’t flex at all under weight. Plenty of YouTube stuff showing how to use. Very versatile for variety of upper body workouts and was surprised can use to stabilize for leg exercises too. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ranger 2

customer_reviews.title: Great, strong set.
customer_reviews.text: So far this set has been great! When I started working out with these I was 220# and attached these to a pull up bar and they have held up well with almost daily usage. I was also concerned about the length of the straps, but they are plenty long. They are long enough for me to hang them from rafters in my garage and still be able keep the rings low enough to pushups, etc.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: High Quality - exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting much, but these bad boys are really durable and the straps work well once you figure them out. Really get a killer work-out in mere minutes. I don't have any issues with them and use them 5 days a week for the last few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Robust
customer_reviews.text: These things are heavy-duty. Very strong polymer. I have used them for stability push-ups and they don't even flex under me (I'm 175lbs). As for the straps, they adjust easily enough and support my entire body. I was able to hang them from a door frame all the way to the ground about 7ft below with plenty of slack left over for at least another 18 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Paris Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Rings broke on me
customer_reviews.text: Had them for about a year, then one day went to do my regular workout and it just snapped. I weigh about 80 kg (176lb) and I had an extra 8 kg dumble (17lb). A total of 193 lb, which is really not that much for the rings. I always kept it indoors when I didn't used it but it seems they just gave up on me today. I don't know if its only a one time thing that happened only to me but one I can say is that it was pretty scary! I recommend investing a little more in the rings and by a more expensive pair.
customer_reviews.author: gilad karlin

customer_reviews.title: Great, solid product, excellent rings
customer_reviews.text: These are a great set of rings. I bought these on short notice because I'm doing a rings program with gmb fitness, and was going camping. I didn't want to skip any of the workouts so I got these because they are so highly reviewed. They fit the bill just about perfectly. The handles were comfortable, the straps good, the buckles had no slippage whatsoever. I do wish the straps were a touch longer, but they worked for what they were bought. Additionally, the kids at the campground loved to swing on them whenever possible. There was usually a line.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter rings
customer_reviews.text: Really liking the rings. Definitely a good starter set and they are fantastic for building strength. I never realized how hard gymnastic ring exercises were until I added them to my weight lifting routine. I have not had any problems with slipping. The only issue I have so far is getting them level. What I did for that was get a white permanent marker and marked off spots on the bands. Not perfect but it seems to be working for now. If you're serious about ring training I would invest in a nice pair of wood rings but for any beginner wanting to try them out these are a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: D. King

customer_reviews.title: These rings are very well made and seem like they will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: These items were bought so I could do stretching and body weight exercises. First off. These rings will humble you. I consider myself to be physically able to do a lot of things. I can do forty unassisted dips, but with these rings I can't do more then a couple. These rings are very well made and seem like they will last a long time. I currently have them hanging off the I beam in our basement and the straps are long enough to hang them even higher. With all things make sure to follow the directions for routing the straps through the buckle correctly. Otherwise they will come loose.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Your Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for the whole family and we all love them. I love that the straps are easy to adjust and very durable. We have left them outside in the rain a few times (because we are lazy and forgetful) and haven't found any problems with any of the components. We hang them from trees and a component we installed in our garage---they work great! What a fantastic price to add a variety to your workout or give the kids a chance to try something different!
customer_reviews.author: Jaz

customer_reviews.title: ... rings for a little over 6 months now and love them. I use them for dips
customer_reviews.text: I've had these rings for a little over 6 months now and love them. I use them for dips, elevated pushups and a few other exercises. My daughter likes to practice her gymnastics with them as well. We've gotten pretty creative with the uses for them. My only complaint was that my clasp broke. While it was still functional (I could manually adjust it to lick the rope in), I was a little afraid of it failing completely during the middle of a set or on my daughter. I e-mailed the company and they sent out a replacement immediately. GREAT customer service. I would gladly order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Why?

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for strength and muscularity
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality rings and straps. Probably one of the best pieces of exercise equipment you can buy for strength and muscular training. You definitely need to begin with very basic exercises, even if your an experienced weightlifter.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Very rugged and durable
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I don't feel like going to the gym and want to do an at home workout. They hold my weight just fine and I feel secure with them. I love how it's easy to change your grip while still having a solid grip when you squeeze on them.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to adjust, the right rings for everybody.
customer_reviews.text: Came exactly as advertised. I was on the fence between getting wooden rings vs plastic but since I like to use them outside on my porch where they can get rained on if the wind is blowing went plastic. They are perfectly comfortable and a very smart design for easy adjustments. In seconds I will use them, then adjust them for my wife to use them, then bring them all the way down for the kids to play with them. I'm glad I got them.
customer_reviews.author: cheesyburgercheese

customer_reviews.title: Brighten up your workout
customer_reviews.text: These rings are a nice bright yellow. They're fairly heavy, which is good, and have a lightly textured surface. The straps are easy to hang and seem to have little or no stretch. I'd say the quality of the rings is a little better than some other plastic rings I've seen, in that the molding line is less visible and can't be felt. If you're not going for wood rings, these are an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Leeson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'3" 215 lbs and they support my weight without any issue. No noticeable flexing of the rings, they feel comparable to wooden rings I have used. I hang them off of my power cage and my kids use them as well. I am glad I bought them. Arrived promptly and seller has great customer service (wrote me follow on emails ensuring I was satisfied). Recommend this seller and this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy rings, kids love them!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for our 7 year old granddaughter who loves to climb, swing, and be active outdoors. Her parents hung them outside and she and her 10 year old brother love them! Great exercise and strength builders.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: These are the best! I use my rings to work out two ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! I use my rings to work out two or three times a week and have seen some great upper body improvements. The grip is excellent even after getting sweaty. You can hang these up literally anywhere. I use tree branches or football goal posts to hang them up on. Sometimes the clamps slip a bit sometimes. Also be sure to read the directions for how to set up the straps. I did not do this and the clips broke, but the straps are still usable.
customer_reviews.author: M2m

customer_reviews.title: Work for my big hands and 200 pound body.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. The rings and straps are more than strong and big enough for my hands and 6'2" 200 pound body. The straps are very long (maybe 14 feet or more). I tried rigging something like this on my own and I never felt comfortable hanging from my own rig. But I feel very comfortable with this rig. Rigged properly (they come with instructions), the buckles will definitely hold the straps where you put them. I wish I had ordered these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase if you already have intermediate strength
customer_reviews.text: Great set of rings. Good friction and feel and easy set up. I don't know why people are having difficulty with the direction of assembly, it has an arrow on the locking device showing the proper direction.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Yasutake

customer_reviews.title: Fun, very strong rings and straps
customer_reviews.text: These are substantial rings, very strong, well made straps. The straps are very long - they should fit anywhere you want to use them, unless you have 30" ceilings! The rings themselves have a nice texture, easy to grip but not too rough. The rings are polycarbonate, the straps very heavy - I think you seriously could lift an elephant with them if you wanted. I have them hanging from the rafters in my shop - 12' ceiling. They are great to play on when I need a break from working. They are helping to increase my strength in my arms - and fun to hang and swing on. Everyone should have these!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kropf

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty simple device
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty simple device, but it works well, and the price is good. If you want to use them for lifted pushups, you can cut a pool noodle lengthwise, and wrap the rings to cushion your feet. Great for working your way up to full pull ups and then for progressing with calisthenics.
customer_reviews.author: x0054

customer_reviews.title: Solid but a little slippery
customer_reviews.text: Great investment, allowing me to hit everything without a gym(with a little creativity)! They are very sturdy and I imagine they'll last a long time. The straps are very stable and simple, very long too. At first, they were a little slippery and on long sessions of pulling/hanging work, my forearms started to feel it a lot, causing some elbow pain. However, this was easily fixed by buying cheap athletic tape and wrapping it around the rings, now super grippy!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Rings work great, excellent customer service, just be sure to fasten it correctly
customer_reviews.text: Bought these rings a year ago to use with my pullup bar and they have worked great. I had the thumb lever on one of the buckles snap off (the buckle itself did not break and still held up the rings) and it turned out it was because I had fastened the buckles incorrectly. I emailed Nayoya explaining the problem and they sent me a brand new set with 2 day shipping at no charge! Great company. For reference, you need to put the strap in UNDER the buckle with the strap coming OUT (not in), that way it will not pressure the thumb lever.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these rings in combination with an Iron Gym bar attached to a doorway frame for about 3 months. They preform really well, but there is one flaw worth mentioning. Both of the buckle clamps snapped due to pressure. They still work as intended, keeping the strap from slipping, it's just now a little more difficult to slide the strap through the buckles. Either the clamp isn't thick enough, or it's too long - maybe both. I'm not overweight either. 165lbs if I eat enough. As long as the clamps don't snap further, I'm fine with the way they are. These rings are still great and I do recommend them. Edit: Check comments for image of broken clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for a great price. No need to spend more' n a hundred dollars on these rings...but the whole suspension training industry is capitalizing on the fad aspect. T-R-X leading the way in charging too much for what can be purchased for less and equal. Word of caution to all users of this or any suspension product...make sure the anchor point is much stronger then needed. Good enough is not enough. And always check the anchor point every workout. And if you have children, keep them them away from these until you have mastered them and can teach them with some knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: thom coco edwards

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: When I received my order the package was damaged and missing one of the straps the other one was of poor quality, mainly due to the buckles slipping when weight was applied. I fixed this by going and getting some better quality straps from my local big box hardware store. the only thing worthwhile about this product was the rings which are lightweight and seem very strong. that's the only reason i didn't give it only one star.
customer_reviews.author: koldsteil

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rings
customer_reviews.text: These rings are great. I hang them from my door-mounted pull-up bar and use them for dips, horizontal rows, ring push-ups, and more. I bought them primarily for use with Reddit's Bodyweight Fitness routine, and they do the job well. The only thing I had to get used to was the strap rubbing against my forearms when performing dips, but my arms are conditioned to that now after about four weeks of use. Read the instructions carefully on setup and you won't have any problems with these rings. I hope they last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Grip isn't as good as wooden rings. Fine for pull ups and dips
customer_reviews.text: The buckle isn't the easiest to feed although once its up it seems strong and there's no slippage of the strap. However the rings are too slippery - fine if you're just doing pull ups or dips; but if you're doing false grip pull ups, muscle ups or some routine with transitions then you have to worry about your grip rather than being fully focused on the exercise technique. It probably doesn't help that I'm using them in a humid country, but I have no issues when using a friends wooden rings. I'll keep these a spare as they're OK for doing dips on but I'll look for a wooden set now.
customer_reviews.author: S Watts

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well priced
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family (even our toddlers) use these rings and love them. We have ours hung from our mounted pull up bar and they are sturdy as long as you install correctly. I like that I hardware is metal and the rings, though plastic, have a good grip and feel to them
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: The plastic has a really nice texture which makes gripping easy.
customer_reviews.text: These rings are made of textured, grippable PC Plastic. I think plastic is preferable for outdoor use. These rings have a nice texture the is pleasant to grip. The diameter of these rings is 1.1 inch rather than 1.25 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with these!!
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with these rings. They are perfect to hang from a pull up bar, a tree branch or anything else that can support the weight. I use them for ring pull ups, ring dips, inverted push ups and a variety of other exercises. The craftsmanship is great, no issues there. The extra directions provided in both the packaging and the Amazon site to ensure they are installed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D. J.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected at the price point. The plastic of the rings themselves is very sturdy and the straps are good enough for any monkeybar gym type activities I plan on doing. As a 275 pound athlete, that's saying something. I didn't expect that these rings would be ideal for muscle ups or dynamic gymnastic activity and they probably aren't. The rings are smooth (nothing to snag or tear) but textured and the straps aren't as thick or as dynamic as I'd trust for the things like muscle ups or anything where you rely on a false grip and need the smooth surface on the rings.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to use and have been great quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. They are easy to use and have been great quality. We hung them from a chain between the trees in our backyard ( looks terribly cheesy), however, my husband does he cross workouts on them and my toddlers swing from them!
customer_reviews.author: JenT

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy product even for big guys
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for the entire family to use. My wife and I utilize to work out and my youngest daughter practices her gymnastics on them. I way 245lbs and they hold me up just fine with no slipping. Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.author: J Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using gymnastic rings, so I researched as best I could the different products available. I chose the Nayoya rings because I read that they had a tremendously high strength rating. I'm a bigger guy, and was concerned with breaking the rings doing pull ups, muscle ups, dips and other body weight exercises. I use these rings daily, and am delighted with my purchase. I would recommend these rings over any of the MUCH pricier options available. A great set of rings for an outstanding price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Clark

customer_reviews.title: So good, I bought it twice!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased a set of these rings in 2014. After almost six years of weekly use in a garage gym - that is, exposed to frequent humidity and temperature changes - one of the buckles broke. I was so satisfied with the durability of this product under those less-than-ideal conditions that I immediately bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: LanceM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Be mindful when installing...
customer_reviews.text: These rings rock! I did read some of the reviews about slippage of the straps, and had concerns. I too initially installed them in incorrectly. There were not specific written instructions and logic led me to insert the straps in one direction, but physics AND a closer look at the metal clasp with directional (symbol) instructions led me to insert the straps in the proper direction. Once done, these rings are amazing! I use them for Crossfit training & they are easy on the hands. My tween son uses them like a monkey (upside down pull-ups are a breeze).
customer_reviews.author: geekgrrl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent equipment for the advanced user
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a birthday present for my son, who is a personal trainer and very athletic. He said they are VERY difficult to use, but that's why he wanted them. These will take his workout to the next level for sure! I wouldn't recommend these to someone who is not already fit. My son does 10 sets of 10 pullups each time he works out, so if he says they are difficult, they are! Only for the advanced user, IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: They work great
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'2" and 215lbs and these things feel very sturdy for me. I just hanged them to my (9ft) ceiling with some strong eye hooks and can do my pullups/dips from them easily. It took a bit of time to adjust them at first when I needed to change the height, but it's quick now that I've gotten the hang of it. The only real con would be that they don't come with useful installation instructions... and it's important that you do it right or they won't be secure. I had to look up a general guide online.
customer_reviews.author: taekvideo

customer_reviews.title: Fun for rainy days!
customer_reviews.text: These rings are great fun for the kids. I installed these in our play room and my kids love playing on them. They discovered they can put their legs through them and sit while swinging. The quick adjustments for height means that we can accommodate older and younger siblings and friends. We have also taken them to parks and friends houses, they have been a big hit! I have always wanted an easy way to build upper body strength, so every time I walk by them I do some pull ups or just swing around on them. I highly recommend these for kids and the young at heart.
customer_reviews.author: sheffdog

customer_reviews.title: I welded an apparatus to use these at home as well and my kids love them too
customer_reviews.text: These are fabulous rings. I use them for core improvement as my main focus is being a competition powerlifter. I welded an apparatus to use these at home as well and my kids love them too. Very easy to adjust and I have yet to have any problem with them. I've been telling people at the gym to try these out. I haven't experienced any slippage like I expected to with non wooden rings, most of the time I don't even use chalk.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Wood is a little more comfortable (from my gymnastic days)
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time as expected. Send to be well designed. Kind of regret not going with the wood rings, but I might get a 2nd set and use these for travel. Wood is a little more comfortable (from my gymnastic days). These work great though and will get a lot of use. My kids (and their friends) definitely love them too.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Wollschlager

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: Rings are great. One thing to note: since these aren't wooden, gripping the rings will be a little harder if your hands are sweaty. To remedy I just add chalk. I don't mind doing this but for some people I can see it as a buying point.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Overal pleased
customer_reviews.text: Great value. The rings are very high quality and I have used them for weeks now. The straps that are supplied work well and do support my weight, however i did find their excessive length to be a little annoying. I did not want to cut them so i wrapped them around the clamps. Also, for those not sure how these secure safely, it is a metal clamp that closes on the straps. At first it didn't seem secure but after just a change or 2 (wrapping and positioning) it has been solid ever since. Great for full upper-body and core workout. Very Pleased and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: larussa

customer_reviews.title: These are an excellent purchase. They arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: My son is a pole vaulter in high school. These are an excellent purchase. They arrived quickly. They have excellent grips and the straps adjust easily. They are well-made and can bear a significant amount of weight. My husband tried them and he is a little over 200 pounds. They were also easy to hang. We recommend you purchase 2 sturdy eye hole rings from the hardware store to affix them. We purchased 2 for a little over a dollar and drilled them into our garage ceiling before hanging the rings. Overall, I highly recommend these rings for pole vaulters, gymnasts, and those into personal fitness.
customer_reviews.author: BME

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality rings
customer_reviews.text: Great value and quality. We are still looking for a place to permanently install these. But the times I have set them up have been great for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Chojnacki

customer_reviews.title: Best workout ever.
customer_reviews.text: The rings came on time and I love the workouts. I consider this harder than standard pull ups with a bar and weig ht training. The only issue I have I'd when you change the setting on the straps you have to make sure it's secure otherwise you will surely hurt yourself. It's important to check to see if the straps or whatever it is you do which entails doing something to hold your weight. This product you have to make sure the straps are locked in place no matter how secure they feel.
customer_reviews.author: Omari Lecky

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Strong and Simple. Great value for starting out on rings. I've talked to a bunch of people while working out at the park and they say that one day wood might be needed for more advanced movements as smoother grips could be helpful but starting out these are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Hanson Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great price for these.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I'm still really bad at them, but it's probably the best upper body workout you can get, and that's coming from a rock climber. You may want to have some climbing chalk for these if you use them for a long session. Sweaty hands can slip off, since they are hard plastic, rather than the wood ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I am not a gymnast and cannot explain why these rings are excellent, but they fit perfectly in my hands
customer_reviews.text: My new Nayoya Gymnastic Rings replaced makeshift rings that I had been using for several years. The Nayoya rings were such a relief! They caused me to ask myself why I waited so long. I am not a gymnast and cannot explain why these rings are excellent, but they fit perfectly in my hands. The right width. The right density. The plastic isn't affected by sun, rain, cold. They are just great! I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Banana!

customer_reviews.title: Attachment for Door Pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: These are solid rings that hold my weight very well. One thing I wanted to mention was that they work great with a in-the-door pull up bar as an attachment to be able to do various other exercises in the home.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: COVID-19 stay home has forced other ways to keep strong and challenged. These rings are sturdy and engineered with high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Doost

customer_reviews.title: Love these rings
customer_reviews.text: Love these rings. Have 2 pairs of them, one inside and one outside. The outdoor pair have shown 0 wear, and are looped up on a board nailed to two trees. Weather has not done anything to the rings or straps. Inside pair are just as nice, and have an extra 6 months on them. Owned them for over a year, and love how quickly I can get a workout in! Only complaint is that during certain exercises the rough straps rub against my arms and cause bad irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wardwell

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality and great service.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. These things are great. Bought them for my son as part of a "ninja gym" I was building but these are the real deal and I'm using them as well. Excellent instructions included to make sure you connect the straps right. Would have been lost without it.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, especially for the price, with clear instructions. My hands are small but I can get a really good, comfortable grip on these and they have a nice, textured feel for minimal slippage. The straps are very long so there is a lot of leeway to mount them, and you can adjust them to any height for progression. I am new to ring work, so I can't speak to how they hold up with lots of sweat; I can barely hold my self up on them. This is going to be fun!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good body weight work out
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting stronger every day. Started out just hanging on them every time I passed them and have gotten much stronger as a result. Still not like the gymnasts at the Olympics, but maybe one day...
customer_reviews.author: BAN

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rings
customer_reviews.text: Great rings. I found them from Tim Ferriss' blog. They are nice, especially for plastic. The straps are super strong and I have no issues trusting them to hold all 220 pounds of me.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Von Holt

customer_reviews.title: Work like a charm on doorway pullup bar.
customer_reviews.text: I really love these. I never thought of hanging these from my doorway pullup bar until a friend mentioned it. It feels AWESOME to do dips and dip holds from these. They provides a new way to do body weight rows. I'm sure there are plenty of advanced uses once my core gets stronger as well. I won't be going back to weights for a while... except for deadlifts and squats.
customer_reviews.author: Dr d

customer_reviews.title: so it seems they are pretty well built
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these rings for over 6 months. I have them set up in the backyard and it's exposed to rain and sun every single day since i set them up. Still havent noticed any degradation or wear on the straps, rings or the metal buckets, so it seems they are pretty well built. (I change the set up/rings height at least 4 times a week and still no wear) Overall a great purchase and a good way to work out. These rings not only provide you body weight exercises, they build up your entire upper body and core strength. I though i was "decently" fit until i tried these. Buy with confidence and workout hard.
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: Good product--a bit of documentation would be nice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for the gymnast in our household. He is very happy with the feel and quality of the rings. I would have liked a simple sheet of paper showing the proper way to string these up. Threading the end of the strap through the buckle is a bit of a pain--I suspect I'm doing something wrong, but without information from the manufacturer, who knows? They are set up in our yard, so we will see how they stand up to the sun, rain and daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Quahog

customer_reviews.title: Buy this set or save up for a set from Rogue.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to ring training and this set is great value for its price. Everything works well, the rings feel good, you may or may not use chalk and thats up to you. Shipping was super quick as well. One thing that would make this perfect if it could come with its own drawstring bag or Amazon would suggest a drawstring bag when people come looking to buy rings on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Salihin

customer_reviews.title: Great Gymnastics Rings!
customer_reviews.text: These will be so much fun if I ever get them hung somewhere! I might give them to my son whose company is housed in a large warehouse. They keep a yoga swing there. It's a fun place to hang around! These rings and the strap are heavy and very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Nitzberg, signature artist

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: The rings are so solid and work really well. I am 6'3", 230lbs. They support my weight great. If only I could support my weight using them better.😄 Getting stronger every time. I took my time to learn how to use the buckles. Once I got it down, I installed the rings to my pull up bar in the back yard and I was in business. Setting up a home gym is a worthwhile endeavour.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reid

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Nayoya Gymnastic Rings a couple years ago and have used them quite a bit. They are exactly as expected from the pictures and description. A good quality product that seems like it will last indefinitely. If I needed the same thing again I wouldn't look for anything else. I used to do a lot changing up the strap lengths during my workouts, and the straps on these can be adjusted quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Josef K

customer_reviews.title: The company's  video for use of straps was great for the install process!
customer_reviews.text: The company offers a great video online to show you how to work the straps. For easy to install, great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Candice McDonald

customer_reviews.title: CAME WITH ONLY ONE STRAP
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered mine it only came with one strap, so I can’t use them. The product would be great if this could be rectified.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Morris

customer_reviews.title: These tedious buckles...
customer_reviews.text: ... are so stupidly designed you'd have to think they were kidding. Enjoy wasting half your workout fumbling around with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Explosion

customer_reviews.title: Idk if it gets any better than these.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been rocking with these bad boys since July I believe. I’ve used them about 3 to 6 times a week and they’ve helped me attain some amazing gains. Along with the fact that I’ve been using them to train friends of mine, these are prime gymnastics rings that still look new. I’ll probably be using these for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: William Santiago

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: They do exactly what they are supposed to, super easy to set up and adjust. Heck the straps are almost irrelevant, any ratchet strap will do you, it's the rings that are great. They are solid, textured and comfortable. I don't' find myself slipping as i get sweaty and haven't had to use chalk yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Marzolf

customer_reviews.title: Versatile exercise equipment
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with these. So far they’re great for a huge variety of workouts. Really helps since I can’t go to a gym!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary L

customer_reviews.title: The Best Strength and Mobility Training Equipment!
customer_reviews.text: These rings arrived quickly and were easy to install on a beam above my deck. I use them every single day and I am incredibly pleased with them, especially for something so affordable. They have been one my best purchases!! I am making huge progress in my strength and fitness goals by using them (calisthenics and Breakdancing). The seller has been very helpful and friendly. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the slightly pebbled finish on the rings that helps ...
customer_reviews.text: No complaints whatsoever. This is a straightforward no BS quality product. Only 3 parts: ring, strap, and buckle. Each part is high quality built to last. I like the slightly pebbled finish on the rings that helps grip with sweaty hands. Provides a great workout and allows me to practice ring dips and muscle up progression exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: These rings are fantastic for calisthenics and they are excellent in terms of ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these rings and hung them from my pull up bar. These rings are fantastic for calisthenics and they are excellent in terms of quality and what they are meant to do. Excellent pair of rings to own if you want to turn your room into a mini gym, and these rings can practically train any part of the upper body. Very good for curls and triceps extensions as well as doing inverted rows and chest contractions.
customer_reviews.author: Henry C

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed by the quality! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: The rings are plastic but feel solid in my hands. I was worried they would feel cheap and flimsy, but they dont! The buckle and straps are pretty easy to use. This assembles in about a minute. You can also coil up any extra strap and wrap it up with the velcro that comes with the ring set. I am 145lbs and the straps have not budged yet.
customer_reviews.author: Freemark

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: These are going to work great. I purchased them for my son who takes gymnastics. The rings are very hard plastic and a little big to grip, but as his hands grow they will be fine. I can adjust the straps to hang from them and flip. The straps, if you follow the very simple instructions, stay tight and do not slip even with an adult. Our basement ceiling is lower than I'd like for using them, but we made it work. I would give 5 stars if the rings were a little softer for grip.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rings
customer_reviews.text: I've had these rings for a while now and they are amazing. They took my core workouts to the next level. Extremely durable, I even keep them outdoors without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: FL Boar

customer_reviews.title: Versatile workout equipment
customer_reviews.text: Great price. I use them, my kids use them! We do gymnastics moves on them as well as just simple pull ups and dips. Great quality and very good price for the versatility!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Irving

product_meta.title: NAYOYA Gymnastic Rings Workout Set with Adjustable Straps for Full Body Strength Training and Bodyweight Crossfit Exercise
feature_bullets: BEST RATED GYM RINGS ON THE MARKET; Includes 2 Gymnastic Rings with straps and adjusting buckles; The rings are made of textured, grippable PC Plastic (to reduce slippage associated with sweaty hands)which is stronger, more durable and of higher quality material then ABS plastic rings and are capable of supporting up to 2,000 lbs making them the best quality gymnastics rings on the market
TAKES 5 MINUTES TO SET UP, USE AND ADJUST providing you with a great home gym substitute

UNLIMITED BODY WEIGHT EXERCISES; Ring training is a very mobile and versatile way to engage your muscles and core with exercises such as pullups, pushups, dips, rows, muscle ups for a functional and varied free range of movement; Great for kids to use in the backyard and for avid exercise lovers to use in the gym or anywhere they can safely hang them

THE PROPER WAY TO INSTALL THE STRAPS is to go from underneath the buckle and slide the straps in the same direction the arrow on the buckle is pointing to; Note where the arrow points on the buckle for proper installation; Proper installation will ensure that your straps will be secure and non slip
DEVELOP the aesthetically pleasing physique of a gymnast while strengthening your core, tendons, joints and accessory muscles
